panels.description: unsafe_da_bytes is an estimate of the DA footprint from all unsafe blocks loaded from the sequencer. Throttling is triggered when it exceeds a threshold (default is 3.2MB).
panels.title: Unsafe L2 DA Bytes

panels.description: When the pending_blocks_bytes dips below the threshold, a P1 alert fires
panels.title: Data Rates (bytes/sec)
Blob Used Bytes Histogram Over Time

panels.description: If blob base fee is > 16x base fee, consider switching from blobs to calldata (this will be automatic if the batcher is configured for auto DA selection). Note that the batcher's internal DA switching logic uses a more involved calculation than the dashboard so may not switch DA type precisely when the panel would indicate it should -- see batcher logs filtered for cost_ratio.
panels.title: Basefee & suggested tip cap [log(wei)]
Required TX gas bumps to inclusion

panels.description:
Shows which controller is active an the intensity of the throttling in [0,1]. Expect positive values only when unsafe_da_bytes is over the throttling threshold.

Left axis: raw data with floating limits to make it easier to see when throttling is active. Right axis: normalised as a perecentage, showing how intense throttling really is.
panels.title: Throttling Intensity

panels.description: Base fee can be affected by throttling, and (upcoming) MinBaseFee and DAFootprintBlockLimit features from Jovian. Blob gas used stores the DA footprint when Jovian activates.
panels.title: L2 Base fee, Gas used, Blob gas used
